intro: Ferulago thirkeana, commonly known as the Thirkean fumitory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Afghanistan and Pakistan. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Ferulago thirkeana is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
